intro: Dryopteris oligocarpa var. crassistipitata, commonly known as the broad-stiped wood fern, is a variant of the broad-leaf wood fern. It is a deciduous fern characterized by its large, bipinnate fronds that are typically 60–120 cm in length. The fronds are dark green on the upper surface and lighter on the underside, with prominent, broad, and spreading pinnae. This variety is native to the eastern United States and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the understory vegetation.
